articles.title: London’s Newest Designer Hotel And Celebrity Haunt: The Broadwick Soho
articles.description: The Broadwick Soho is the first hotel in London designed by the famed Martin Brudnizki and is attracting the cool crowd from London and abroad with its eclectic  private club vibe.
articles.content: “I’m never leaving this hotel,” proclaimed Sheryl Crow to the privileged onlookers gathered recently in a stylish rooftop bar in London to hear the Rock & Roll Hall of Famer belt out her long list of ... [8520 symbols]
articles.summary: The Broadwick Soho, London's newest designer hotel and celebrity haunt, was conceived by hotel owner Noel Hayden and Managing Director Jo Ringestad. The hotel, which opened less than a year ago, was the brainchild of Hayden's childhood owner, Noel Sr., a former circus performer, and mother Jackie, who owned a successful 120-room seaside hotel in Bournemouth, England. The loss of the hotel was devastating for Hayden, but his desire to own his own hotel inspired him to create an opulent contemporary retreat. Hayden enlisted internationally acclaimed interior designer Martin Brudnizki to design the hotel, and the results are remarkable. The Broadwick showcases British eccentricity and maximalism, including handcrafted Murano mirrors and lamps from Italy and a variety of fabrics and materials.

articles.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' presidential campaign has released its first official video, set to Beyoncé's "Freedom" from her album "Lemonade." The video contrasts Harris' opponent, former President Trump, highlighting her contrast with his campaign and criminal record. Since Harris' announcement on Sunday, her campaign has reported a record 24-hour fundraising haul and gained support from elected Democrats and over 100,000 new volunteers. Her top issues are gun reform, reproductive rights, child poverty, and health care affordability. Harris has received A-list Hollywood endorsements and the support of Democrats in Congress. She is expected to be more popular among America's youngest voters than former president Biden.

Eva, who is a mother to three children, explained that she had chosen the gown to'show her figure' and celebrate herself as a woman. Barkley had no idea his conversation with Giants management was recorded and aired on the documentary television series. He insists he was portrayed fairly, despite the recorded call being offside. Barkley signed a three-year deal with the Eagles for $26 million guaranteed and $37.75 million overall, making him the highest-paid running back in franchise history. The show's coverage of Barkley's departure was part of a series detailing his departure from the Giants after six seasons. Since 2001, the show has been a staple of the NFL fans' view of the show, focusing on specific teams during summer training camps and the regular season.

articles.summary: King Charles has saved taxpayers $25 million by introducing cost-saving measures to reduce the royal family's spending, with a 17% decrease in overall spending to $115 million. The monarch, who has pledged to slim down the monarchy, introduced these measures in an effort to reduce spending. Despite the family's struggles with health issues including cancer and cancer, the royals have continued to perform 2,300 engagements across the UK and overseas. The Sovereign Grant accounts reveal that the royal couple spent $1 million on Charles' coronation celebrations last year, while the energy crisis in 2023 led to Buckingham Palace's electricity bill soaring by $1.3 million. Despite Charles' desire for a smaller monarchy, his sister Princess Anne has previously opposed this idea, suggesting it was already streamlined enough.

articles.summary: The Paris 2024 Olympic Games officially begins on Friday, with the opening ceremony on the River Seine. There will be 329 medal events across 32 sports, with preliminary action starting on July 24. The last sporting action and closing ceremony are on August 11. However, viewing on terrestrial television in the UK is limited due to the BBC's limited coverage being split across two live streams. For comprehensive live coverage, subscribers will need to subscribe to Discovery+, which offers a special Olympics offer for £3.99 per month. The main European rights holder for the Olympics is Warner Bros Discovery, which also co-owns TNT Sport. BBC One and BBC Two will cover British athletes and broadcast the biggest events, but the BBC can broadcast a maximum of two live stream of action at any one time.

articles.summary: Hayley Matthews, a TV and radio presenter, has been jailed for embezzling £120,000 from her dementia-addled mother, Janice Matthews, to fund a lavish lifestyle. The 44-year-old used the money to spend on items such as a £1,300 Mulberry bag, over £13,600 on Amazon, and shopping at luxury stores such as Harvey Nichols, Kurt Geiger and Molton Brown. The scheme was exposed when other family members questioned the size of Ms Matthews's estate after she died in a hospital care facility in 2021. Matthews was sentenced to two years and three months in prison.

The production, adapted from Dickens, features a score of Lionel Bart's songs and performances by Matthew Bourne, Matthew Bourse, Jean-Pierre van der Spuy, and Lez Brotherston. Despite the artistic excellence and musical performances, it feels safe, tame and nostalgic. Simon Lipkin plays Fagin, playing Fagin as a Jewish character who reflects his Jewish heritage, and Cian Eagle-Service plays the role of Oliver. Despite this, the production does acknowledge the problematic character of Fagin. The review concludes that the show could be renamed Fagin!

articles.summary: HarperCollins Publishers is planning massive reprints to meet demand for JD Vance's book, "Hillbilly Elegy," following his selection by former President Donald Trump as his running mate. The publisher announced that over 600,000 copies of the book have been sold since Trump's announcement on July 15. The book, which tells of Vance's childhood in Ohio and his family's roots in rural Kentucky, was widely cited as essential reading for understanding Trump's appeal to working class whites after his victory in 2016. Despite criticism, the book has been adapted into a feature film.

articles.summary: The BBC Proms 2024 will be held from 19 July to 14 September, presenting eight weeks of world-class music from orchestras across the UK and around the world. This year's festival will feature some of the world's top international orchestras, including the Bavarian Radio Symphony Orchestra under Sir Simon Rattle, the Berlin Philharmonic under Kirill Petrenko, the Czech Philharmonics under Jakub Hrůša, the Orchestre de Paris under Klaus Mäkelä, and the West–Eastern Divan under Daniel Barenboim. BBC Television and BBC iPlayer will broadcast 24 programmes, including The First Night and Last Night of the Proms, across BBC One, BBC Two, BBC Four or CBeebies. Every Prom at the Royal Albert Hall and in the UK will be broadcast on BBC Radio 3 and BBC Sounds, with selected Proms also selected BBC Radio 2, BBC Radio 1 and BBC 6 Music.

articles.summary: The explosive body horror film "The Substance" starring Demi Moore and Margaret Qualley, directed by French heatseeker Coralie Fargeat, is set to open the Midnight Madness section at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). The film follows the story of Hollywood actress Elizabeth Sparkle, who commits the high crime of aging in Hollywood when opportunities for her own opportunities dry up. The festival will also feature a tribute to ‘80s creature features, "Ick," starring former TV Superman Brandon Routh and Mena Suvari, and "Else," about a disease that results from infected humans being absorbed into their physical surroundings. Other notable films include "Friendship," the directorial debut of Andrew DeYoung, "PEN15," "Our Flag Means Death," and "Dead Mail" from Joe DeBecker and Kyle McConaghy.

Abramenko, who has worked with brands including Google, BMW, Visa, Samsung, Danone and Budweiser, is an award-winning director of commercials and music videos.

articles.summary: Rep. Debbie Dingell, a Democrat from Michigan, responded to CNN host Kasie Hunt's questions about President Biden's health or age during an interview. She questioned why he did not discuss these issues during his address to the nation, stating that he could still serve and wanted to bring the party together. Biden had previously stated that he planned to serve out the rest of his term and had chosen to pass the torch to a new generation. After endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris, Biden quickly stated that the election was up to the American people.

articles.title: Warner Bros. stock falls after losing 'key' NBA rights as league secures $77 billion deal with Disney, Comcast, and Amazon

articles.summary: Warner Bros. (Discovery) has lost a key media rights deal with the NBA, sending its shares down about 7% in early trading. The loss comes as the league secured a $77 billion deal with Disney, Comcast, and Amazon. Warner Bros. has been broadcasting NBA games on its TNT network since 1989 and reportedly pays $1.2 billion annually for the rights. This loss will impact TNT's NBA-adjacent content, such as "Inside the NBA." Warner Bros.'s statement stated that it had matched Amazon's media rights bid to continue airing NBA games, but the league rejected the offer. The company plans to sue the NBA for violating its contractual rights to air NBA games.

Despite reports of a struggle to get contestants, production has confirmed that all cast members have signed up for this year and are eager to make the announcement sooner rather than later. The speculation comes after Strictly Come Dancing's professional dancers returned to rehearsals.

articles.summary: Bobby Mackey's Music World in Wilder, known as "the most haunted night club in America," is auctioning off items before it is demolished. The items up for auction include country music memorabilia, furniture and fixtures, stage costumes, items related to the venue's paranormal folklore, and even mechanical bull. The auction will take place online on Aug. 15 at 7 p.m. Buyers will be responsible for shipping costs. The venue is temporarily operating out of the former location of Mugbees Biker Bar and Restaurant and plans to move into its permanent home by around 2026.

articles.summary: Donald Trump's obsession with Hannibal Lecter, the late great character from Silence of the Lambs, has led to speculation that he may replace his running mate, JD Vance. During a rally in North Carolina, Trump mentioned Lecter as his next VP. This reference has been made numerous times throughout the campaign, with many believing it is related to the term'mental asylum' and "asylum seeker". These theories suggest that Trump may confuse the definition of asylum and mistakenly believe all immigrants seeking asylum are automatically insane. However, it is unclear whether Trump believes Lecter is alive or not. The use of the phrase "the late, great Hannibal Lecters" suggests that he might be unable to distinguish fiction from reality.

articles.title: What to know about Sonya Massey, the woman shot by police in her Illinois home
articles.description: A 36 year-old Black woman was fatally shot in her home in Illinois by an officer responding to her 911 call.
articles.content:
What to know about Sonya Massey, the woman shot by police in her Illinois home

A 36 year-old Black woman called 911 to report a potential intruder in her home on July 6. She was fatally shot in her h... [4147 symbols]
articles.summary: Sonya Massey, a 36-year-old Black woman, was fatally shot by a police officer in her home in Springfield, Illinois, on July 6, 2024. Massey had called 911 earlier that night to report a potential intruder. One of the responding officers, Deputy Sean Grayson, had asked Massey to remove a pot of hot water from the stove while inside her home and threatened to shoot her in the face if it was accidental. Grayson then fired three shots at Massey three times. The deputy was later terminated from his position and is facing five counts of aggravated battery, official misconduct, and three counts of first degree murder. His pre-trial release has been granted.

articles.summary: The world's most popular YouTuber, Mr. Beast, has issued a statement regarding the controversy surrounding the firing of Ava Kris Tyson, a collaborator of Mr.Beast, who has been accused of inappropriate contact with minors. Tyson was a key member of Beast's team and was frequently attacked as a trans woman, despite her transition. This changed after Tyson was accused of exchanging inappropriate messages with minors, though the full scope of these allegations remains under investigation. Beast has issued his own statement, stating that he took immediate action to remove Tyson from the company, his channel, and any association with MrBeast, while Tyson stated that it was a mutually decided decision and that she would step away. The situation is similar to that of Dr. Disrespect, where it was revealed that he exchanged inappropriate messages and led to a Twitch ban.

articles.title: ACADEMY AWARD-WINNING ACTRESS, LUPITA NYONG'O, VISITS SOUTH AFRICA AND NAMIBIA TO UNDERSTAND THE CONTRIBUTION OF NATURAL DIAMONDS TO THE ADVANCEMENT OF SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT
articles.description: Academy Award-winning actress and De Beers Global Ambassador, Lupita Nyong'o, visited South Africa and Namibia last week as part of an immersive tour to experience the impact that natural diamonds create for the people and places they come from.
articles.content: LONDON, July 25, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Academy Award-winning actress and De Beers Global Ambassador, Lupita Nyong'o, visited South Africa and Namibia last week as part of an immersive tour to experienc... [5555 symbols]
articles.summary: Academy Award-winning actress and De Beers Global Ambassador, Lupita Nyong'o, visited South Africa and Namibia as part of an immersive tour to learn about the impact natural diamonds create for the people and places they come from. She was given an appreciation for the impact of natural diamonds on sustainable development for host communities in both countries. In South Africa, she visited De Beer's world-class Venetia diamond mine and the 32,000 hectare Venetian Limpopo Nature Reserve adjacent to the mine, which provides protected habitat for threatened and endangered species. In Namibia, she also visited the NDTC (Namibian Diamond Trading Company) and Namdeb, both 50:50 joint ventures between the Namibian Government and Debeers, a 50% joint venture between the government and the company. She also attended a gala dinner attended by the Minister in the Office of the Presidency and high-ranking business leaders. During her visit, she was presented with a courtesy visit to the Namibia President, Dr Nangolo Mbumba, who praised her efforts to demonstrate the positive contribution that natural diamonds make to the country's economy.

articles.title: Diana wrote how Prince William ‘adores his little brother’ in letter to housekeeper
articles.description: ‘Intimate’ note written by the late Princess, which is to be sold at auction, said elder brother smothered youngster in hugs and kisses
articles.content: An “intimate” letter from Diana, Princess of Wales, describing how Prince William “adores his little brother” and smothers him with hugs and kisses, is to be sold at auction. The note, illustrating a ... [3011 symbols]
articles.summary: A letter from Diana, Princess of Wales, describing her love for her brother, Prince William, is set to be auctioned off. The letter, one of several sent from the late Princess to Violet Collison, the family's former housekeeper. Collison was head housekeeper at Park House on the Sandringham Estate in Norfolk and welcomed the births of the Princess and her siblings. The correspondence, being auctioned by Sworders in Stansted Mountfitchet in Essex, reveals that the two women remained in touch throughout Diana's life. Most of the letters are thank-you notes for birthday and Christmas presents given to Diana and the two boys, often with a line or two about Diana's personal life. The auction will take place on July 30.

articles.title: Laura Dern dropped out of college to film 'Blue Velvet' despite being told the decision was 'insane.' The career gamble paid off for the Oscar winner.

articles.summary: Laura Dern, an Oscar-winning actress, dropped out of college to film "Blue Velvet" despite being told the decision was 'insane'. The decision may have been one of her best career moves, as she had faith in the film and its success. Dern initially asked the heads of the film, psychology, and film department heads for a leave of absence, but they declined. She also offered to send school work via mail or "double up classes" in an effort to convince them otherwise. Despite this, Dern's role in David Lynch's film "blue Velvet" led to a wide-ranging acting career.

articles.summary: Whitney Rydbeck, known for his role in Jason Lives: Friday the 13th Part VI and as an original crash test dummy in 1980s safety belt commercials, has died at 79 due to complications from prostate cancer. His most memorable role was as Roy in the Jason Lives sequel, where he played Jason Voorhees. RydBeck also provided the bodies for the dummies and provided the voices. He was praised by his friend and collaborator, Jason Lives director Tommy McLoughlin, who shared stills of his Jason Lives role in his tribute. Rydenbeck began his acting career in the 1970s and later starred in Love at First Bite, Rocky II, 1941, and an episode of M*A*S*H.

articles.summary: HarperCollins Publishers is planning massive reprints to meet demand for JD Vance's book, "Hillbilly Elegy," following his selection by former President Donald Trump as his running mate. The publisher announced that over 600,000 copies of the book have been sold since Trump's announcement on July 15. The book, which tells of Vance's childhood in Ohio and his family's roots in rural Kentucky, was widely cited as essential reading for understanding Trump's appeal to working class whites after his victory in 2016. Despite criticism, the book has been adapted into a feature film.

articles.summary: Taylor Swift's political history has raised concerns about whether she will support Kamala Harris in the upcoming election. Some fans believe that she already indicated her support for Harris during an Eras Tour concert in Hamburg, Germany, during which she played a mashup of her songs "Last Great American Dynasty" and "Run" during the event. While her team did not respond to a request for comment, it is common for Swift to fuse two songs together in a final thought. Jake Deyton, a TikTok influencer, is backing the presumptive Democratic nominee and suggested in a video that Harris should use her marketing skills to help her campaign. However, some Swifties believe that Taylor should empower her fans to vote for whoever aligns with their beliefs, values, opinions and morals.

articles.summary: Sister Wives star Meri Brown has mixed feelings about her 32-year marriage to Kody Brown, who she believes to have considered "wasted time" after their high-profile split. She suggested that she could have started dating in her 40s rather than her 50s if she ended her marriage sooner. Kody, who was previously married to Meri from 1990 to 2014, opted to divorce her and legally wed fourth wife Robyn Brown so he could adopt her children from a past relationship. The couple announced their split on a December 2022 episode of the Sister Wives One-on-One special and committed to kindness and respect towards each other and all family members.

articles.summary: HarperCollins, the publisher of "Hillbilly Elegy," plans to print hundreds of thousands of copies to meet demand for JD Vance's book following his selection as the running mate to former President Donald Trump. Adam announced that applications are now open for the Three Counties Agricultural Society Bursary in Memory of Joe, which supports those seeking further education in agriculture or related subjects. The bursary covers up to three years of study, with up to £1,000 per annum provided each year. Fans praised Adam for preserving his father's legacy, with one calling it a "Wonderful legacy" and another praising him for his commitment to conserving rare breeds. Adam's father died in 2015 from cancer.

articles.summary: Clint Eastwood's longtime partner, Christina Sandera, died at the age of 61 from cardiac arrhythmia. The Monterey County Dept. of Health listed "Arosclerotic coronary artery disease" as an underlying cause of Sandera's death. Sandera died at 1:46 p.m. Her manner of death was listed as "natural". Eastwood and Sandera met nearly a decade ago while she was employed at his Mission Ranch Hotel and Restaurant in Carmel-by-the-Sea near Monterey, California. The actor's daughter, Morgan Eastwood, described Sandera as a "devastating loss" and a "lovely, caring woman." Eastwood was married twice before Sandera and had eight children with his first marriage to model Maggie Johnson.

articles.summary: The author of Halle Butler's Banal Nightmare, author, has become a prominent example of millennials who use therapy lingo to label themselves as "narcissists" and "self-regulation" as a means of enforcing unwritten social codes. The author's novels, like those of Margaret "Moddie" Yance and Jillian, often depict members of their generation's tendency to psychologically chase their own tails. The novel, which is primarily about Margaret "moddie," Yance, an unemployed 30-something who avoids social groups and avoids social attention. The writer argues that self-regulation and avoidance of judgment can be used to exempt your own behavior from scrutiny. Despite this, a greater openness to talking about mental health has its benefits, as well as potential relief and clarity in social media accounts promoting self-care.

articles.summary: Elevation Worship's "Praise," featuring Brandon Lake, Chris Brown and Chandler Moore, has reached a 20th week at No. 1 on Billboard's Hot Christian Songs chart. The song, co-written by Brown with Lake and Moore, is the ninth title to have dominated Hot Christian Song for 20 frames or longer over the survey's 21-year history. It has been topped with 7.4 million audience airplay impressions, 3.4m official U.S. streams and 1,000 downloads sold July 12-18. This marks Lake's second Hot Christian song of at least 20 weeks, following his solo single "Gratitude."

articles.summary: British filmmaker Steve McQueen's "Blitz" has been chosen as the Closing Night selection of the 62nd New York Film Festival (NYFF). The film, which takes place in the 1940s, stars Saoirse Ronan and newcomer Elliott Heffernan. It follows a single mother and son separated as London is under attack by the Germans during World War II. The film will make its North American premiere at the festival on Oct. 10 at Alice Tully Hall and will open in theaters on Nov. 1 and stream on Apple TV+ on Nov 22.

articles.summary: A warehouse worker, Ajmal Aylmer, has accused his boss, William McGinty, of sexual harassment due to his name being 'Willy', according to an employment tribunal. Ailmer had objected to McGiny's name and insisted that he should stop using it as a 'term for penis', even accusing McGinry of 'degrading the whole workplace' when using the abbreviation on the company's timesheet. However, the tribunal dismissed these claims, stating that Willy is a common abbreviation for William and Aylmers did not have a genuine belief that McGinty's first name constituted sexual harassment. The tribunal also accepted that McGinny had always been known as Willy, as his father and grandfather had been.

articles.summary: Netflix's popular show, Cobra Kai, has been replaced by a new show called Dirty Pop: The Boy Band Scam, a crime documentary about how bands like Backstreet Boys and N’Sync were ripped off when they were younger. The show debuted at #1 on Netflix's Top 10 list but was replaced by another show. The replacement is a three-hour series about the alleged scam of Backstreet boys and N'Sync. The release date for Part 2 of the second part of the final season is November, four months from now, and the third part is some time in 2025. This is part of a trend of Netflix breaking up its popular shows into three parts due to its desire to streamline them into smaller batches of episodes rather than two. Other popular shows include All American at #3 and Too Hot to Handle at No.10.

Hayley Matthews, who was als... [2976 symbols]
articles.summary: Former STV and BBC presenter, Hayley Matthews, has been jailed for more than two years after her sister discovered she had embezzled over £120,000 from her dementia-stricken mother, Janice. The money was used to fund an extravagant lifestyle, including a Mulberry handbag and items purchased from the White Company. Following her mother's death in 2021, Ms Matthews told family members her estate was only £36,000. Danielle Thomson obtained copies of financial statements from her mother’s bank and discovered thousands of withdrawn while she was in hospital. She called the police and detectives discovered 371 PayPal transactions totalling £46,763, ATM withdrawals amounting to £38,000, and Amazon purchases worth £13,649.97. Matthews was jailed for two years and three months at Edinburgh Sheriff Court.

articles.summary: Shares of Warner Bros. Discovery fell 8% at the open of the day following the NBA's announcement of three major rights deals with three WBD rivals, effectively eliminating the company from professional basketball. This has led some Wall Street analysts to suggest that the company should split or merge, following the Warner Media-Discovery deal. The loss of these key rights means Discovery loses a core content asset for both its linear networks and its Max streaming service. Tim Nollen of Macquarie Equity Research downgraded the stock to “neutral” from “outperform” and stated that while the shares are cheap already, they don’t see a good fundamental investment case now. WBD has threatened to take “appropriate action" against the NBA, indicating it plans to litigate the decision.

The reality star had faced criticism after sharing photos from a friend's wedding via Instagram. The dress she wore was an all-black Salih Balta gown with a black corset top and sheer skirt, and she kept it simple with black heels, a clutch, minimal jewelry, and loose wavy curls. Some of her followers called the dress "inappropriate" for the occasion and an "epic fail". DeSOrbo defended the dress, stating that she could defend it all day long.

articles.summary: Serbian drama "Mother Mara," directed by Mirjana Karanovic, will have its world premiere at the Sarajevo Film Festival as a gala screening at the festival. The film follows the story of a successful businesswoman and single mother, Mara, who is heartbroken after her son Nemanja's death. She finds solace in her relationship with Milan, who she finds comfort in their relationship. The cast includes Vucic Perovic, Boris lsakovic, Jasna Zalica, Alen Liveric, Pavle Cemerikic, and Jelena Curuvija. The director and actor are known for their roles in films such as "Grbavica" and "When Father Was Away on Business"

keywords.name: the Dame Barbara Windsor Dementia Mission

articles.summary: Scott Mitchell, the widower of EastEnders star Barbara Windsor, has spoken about his late wife's death. Mitchell revealed that Barbara Windsor often confused him with another family member during her final days and still knew who he was. She was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014 and died in 2020 aged 83. Mitchell, who married Windsor in 2000, first noticed symptoms in 2009 and was left with a broken jaw a year later. Following Windsor's death, Mitchell became the People's Champion of the UK dementia mission, named after his late spouse.

articles.description: College football players are finally getting to be themselves — or play against themselves — in one of the hottest video games on the planet.
articles.content:
GAINESVILLE, Fla. (AP) — Freshman quarterback DJ Lagway grabbed a controller, settled comfortably into a leather stool and immediately started to adjust Florida’s roster.

There was only one move to m... [5268 symbols]
articles.summary: New EA Sports video game, College Football 25, has been released for the first time, allowing college football players to play in one of the hottest video games on the planet. The game, which was dormant for 11 years, allows players to profit from their brand and is now being used as a platform for players to create their own players. The release of EA Sports' college football game was celebrated by schools across the country, with players being offered a chance to be featured in the game. The team also highlighted the realistic aspects of the game, including the ability to shake tackles and crowd noise, and the use of NIL deals and transfer portal NIL. Despite the game's popularity, Florida's Freshman quarterback DJ Lagway's overall rating is the highest of the group at 80.

articles.title: Industry, Globe mourn the loss of Ask the Garden Guy’s R. Wayne Mezitt
articles.description: An icon in the plant world, he was a mentor to many and a steward of responsible horticulture.
articles.content: “He and I would go out in the woods as a young couple, all starry-eyed, [and] we would see other couples go off to be alone and so forth, but Wayne and I would walk through the woods, admiring the tri... [9084 symbols]
articles.summary: R. Wayne Mezitt, the author of Ask the Garden Guy and American Landscape Association, has died after battling a tick-borne illness. Mezit, a prominent horticulturist in the plant world, became an icon through mentoring and developing hybrid plant varieties across the country. He held leadership positions across regional and national horticulture groups and was a key figure in the industry. Despite his struggles, colleagues credit his dedication to conscientious horticultural practices and industry. The Globe and other publications mourn the loss of him.

articles.title: I Saw the TV Glow is queer, cool and incredibly powerful filmmaking – review
articles.description: Jane Schoenbrun’s celebrated follow-up to ‘We’re All Going to the World’s Fair’ – which is finally being released on UK shores – is about how art can sometimes know us before we truly know ourselves
articles.content: I Saw the TV Glow could be the hand on your shoulder that you didn’t know you needed. It’s a film about the things offered by art that could never be articulated within a critic’s review. So, in a way... [3263 symbols]
articles.summary: I Saw the TV Glow, Jane Schoenbrun's follow-up to their 2021 thriller We're All Going to the World’s Fair, is a film about how art sometimes knows us before we know ourselves. The film follows the story of two kids, Owen (a haunting Justice Smith) and Maddy (Brigette Lundy-Paine), who first met in 1996 and their relationship with a supernatural TV show called The Pink Opaque. Despite critics comparing the show to The Vampire Slayer and Twin Peaks, I Saw The TV Glow is considered powerful and engaging. It is in cinemas from 26 July.

articles.content:

The Duke of Sussex said such worries may be seen as paranoia – unti... [1592 symbols]
articles.summary: Prince Harry has claimed that his fight against UK tabloids negatively impacted his relationship with his family. The Duke of Sussex stated that the intrusion into his private life led to paranoia and fear. He also mentioned that his mother, Princess Diana, was possibly hacked in the mid-90s and that there is evidence to suggest she was one of the first people to be hacked. Harry has ongoing cases against two other tabloid publishers over claims they used unlawful means for stories about him, although he dropped a libel case against the Mail earlier this year. He lost a lawsuit against the government's decision to grant him security protection when in the UK, but was cleared in court in January.

articles.title: Unforgotten star takes on brand new role with all-star cast away from ITV series
articles.description: Unforgotten star Sanjeev Bhaskar will be returning to screens across the nation for a new Murder, They Hope special called Apocalypse Slough.
articles.content: Sanjeev Bhaskar, star of ITV drama Unforgotten, will be making a comeback to our screens with a special Murder, They Hope episode dubbed Apocalypse Slough. The veteran actor, aged 60, is set to share ... [2756 symbols]
articles.summary: Sanjeev Bhaskar, star of ITV drama Unforgotten, is set to make a comeback with a special episode of Murder, They Hope, titled Apocalypse Slough. The veteran actor, aged 60, will share the spotlight with Johnny Vegas and Sian Gibson, known for their roles as Terry and Gemma Bremmer. Sarah Hadland will play Gemma's sister, Monica, and Jason Cook, the creative force behind ApocalypseSlough, expressed their excitement at their reunion. The episode involves Gemma pursuing her dream to become an investigator at the Serious Crimes Agency (SCA), leading to tension between the pair as they investigate a double murder investigation at a local rugby club. UKTV has greenlit the standalone special, with Sarah Asante, UKTV's commissioning editor for scripted comedy, Gerald Casey, and Hilary Rosen, director of commissioninginging, all ordering orders.

articles.title: Verbena Free-Spirited celebrates one year, adds functional beverages to its mocktail menu
articles.description: Verbena Free-Spirited see the sober movement embrace functional beverages.
articles.content: CLEVELAND, Ohio --Molly Cheraso opened Verbena Free-Spirited Shoppe, a coffee bar by day and spirit-free bar in in the afternoon/evening, in Hingetown one year ago. At that time, she thought she was g... [572 symbols]
articles.summary: Molly Cheraso, a coffee bar and spirit-free bar in Hingetown, Cleveland, has added functional beverages to its mocktail menu for its one-year anniversary. The bar is now serving coffee and evening drinks, offering a variety of mocktails that can mimic popular cocktails or create a new flavor profile. These functional beverages are intended to enhance health, mood, performance, or enhance health or enhance all three. The owner, who started the business a year ago, now incorporates functional beverages into her non-alcohol menu.
